p: A multicenter, open-label, randomized controlled trial of 150 patients with mild–moderate COVID-19 revealed that antimalarial drugs led to a similar probability of virus eradication when compared to standard care, establishing neither benefits nor significant increase of risks, discouraging the use of HCQ in those patients [ 24]. However, in a cohort study of 90 hospitalized patients with COVID-19, patients taking HCQ and azithromycin had greater QT interval prolongation than those taking HCQ alone [ 25].
